parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship. From latris; to minister, i.e. Render religious homage.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation. Apparently akin to skeuos and skia; a tent or cloth hut.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
